alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 12:27PM MST until December 02 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Cheyenne County in east central Colorado... Wallace County in west central Kansas... Sherman County in northwestern Kansas... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 1226 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a cold front extending from 8 miles north of St. Francis to 7 miles east of Bonny Reservoir to 4 miles north of Bethune to near Genoa, moving southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar, satellite imagery and public reports. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 35. Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 169. This wall of dust will be near... Goodland around 1250 PM MST. Sharon Springs around 110 PM MST. Wallace around 115 PM MST. Cheyenne Wells around 130 PM MST. Other locations impacted by this wall of dust include Edson, Firstview, Wild Horse, Arapahoe and Aroya. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
